body:
### Problem

I'm getting this broken warning from python CheckHealth. Notice the blank-space after "But $PATH yields this python-argcomplete...". Every check that I do looks correct.



NVIM v0.9.0

Wrapper script that activates venv.
[We suffer from slow NFS, so I like to run nvim out of the fastest filesystem I could find: /dev/shm.]
```
#!/bin/sh
source /proj/*****/envs/globals_python3.11/bin/activate
[ -r /dev/shm/nvim/usr/bin/nvim ] && exec /dev/shm/nvim/usr/bin/nvim $*
mkdir /dev/shm/nvim
nvim_usr_dir="/proj/*****/bin/$(readlink /proj/*****/bin/latest-nvim)/squashfs-root/usr"
/bin/cp -r $nvim_usr_dir /dev/shm/nvim
exec /dev/shm/nvim/usr/bin/nvim $*
```

`:CheckHealth`
```
Python 3 provider (optional)
- Using: g:python3_host_prog = "/proj/*****/envs/globals_python3.11/bin/python3"
- Executable: /proj/*****/envs/globals_python3.11/bin/python3
- Python version: 3.11.3
- pynvim version: 0.4.3
- WARNING Could not contact PyPI to get latest version.
- ERROR HTTP request failed: unable to get pypi response

Python virtualenv
- WARNING $VIRTUAL_ENV is set to: /proj/*****/envs/globals_python3.11
  And its /bin directory contains: python, python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script, python3, python3.11
  But $PATH yields this python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script executable:
  This script is part of the Python argcomplete package (https:/github.com/kislyuk/argcomplete).
  It is used to check if an EASY-INSTALL-SCRIPT wrapper redirects to a script that contains the string
  "PYTHON_ARGCOMPLETE_OK". If you have enabled global completion in argcomplete, the completion hook will run it every
  time you press <TAB> in your shell.

  Usage:
  python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script <input executable file>

  And $PATH in subshells yields this python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script executable:
  This script is part of the Python argcomplete package (https:/github.com/kislyuk/argcomplete).
  It is used to check if an EASY-INSTALL-SCRIPT wrapper redirects to a script that contains the string
  "PYTHON_ARGCOMPLETE_OK". If you have enabled global completion in argcomplete, the completion hook will run it every
  time you press <TAB> in your shell.

  Usage:
  python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script <input executable file>

  So invoking Python may lead to unexpected results.
  - ADVICE:
    - $PATH ambiguities arise if the virtualenv is not properly activated prior to launching Nvim. Close Nvim, activate the virtualenv, check that invoking Python from the command line launches the correct one, then relaunch Nvim.
    - $PATH ambiguities in subshells typically are caused by your shell config overriding the $PATH previously set by the virtualenv. Either prevent them from doing so, or use this workaround: https://vi.stackexchange.com/a/34996
```

Checking the path find for this script, it looks correct.
```
:!type -a python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script
python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script is /proj/*****/envs/globals_python3.11/bin/python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script
```

My path doesn't have any spaces. The venv bin dir is first in the list as expected.
```
:!echo $PATH
/proj/*****/envs/globals_python3.11/bin:<lots-of-other-stuff-with-no-spaces-or-other-weird-characters>
```

### Steps to reproduce

nvim (both --clean and normal)
:CheckHealth

### Expected behavior

No WARNINGs unless there's something potentially wrong with my environment.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.9.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

NA

### Operating system/version

Redhat 8

### Terminal name/version

KiTTY

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

appimage --appimage-extract

comment_data.body: Send a PR. checkhealth is best-effort.

title: CheckHealth, Python, unclear and apparently unwarranted WARNING about $VIRTUAL_ENV and python-argcomplete-check-easy-install-script
